meanings.sent1: After playing outside all day, the kids were zonked and ready for bed.
meanings.sent2: She felt zonked after running a marathon.
meanings.sent3: The puppy looked zonked after chasing its tail for hours.
meanings.sent4: The old car sputtered to a stop, its engine zonked from the long journey.
meanings.sent5: The students were zonked after studying for their final exams all night.

meanings.sent1: He zonked the ball with all his might, sending it flying over the fence.
meanings.sent2: The boxer zonked his opponent with a powerful uppercut.
meanings.sent3: The pillow fight turned serious when one friend zonked the other on the head.
meanings.sent4: The hammer zonked the nail into the wood effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The chef zonked the garlic cloves to release their flavor into the dish.

meanings.definition: To be under the influence of drugs or alcohol.
meanings.sent1: She accidentally zonked herself with the strong pain medication.
meanings.sent2: The partygoers zonked on the dance floor after a few too many drinks.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be zonked after licking spilled wine off the floor.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of freshly baked cookies zonked her senses, making her feel warm and happy.
meanings.sent5: The music zonked his mind, transporting him to a different world.
